publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1844 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cost Limits of the Holyrood Project—That the Parliament believes, mindful of the terms of the resolution on the Holyrood project agreed to on 5 April 2000 and of the belief engendered by that resolution amongst people in Scotland that the new Parliament building would cost £195 million, that any revised cost limits, quality standards or completion dates under consideration by the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body or the Holyrood Progress Group must be laid for debate and approval before the Scottish Parliament.

S1M-1844 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cost Limits of the Holyrood Project—That the Parliament believes, mindful of the terms of the resolution on the Holyrood project agreed to on 5 April 2000 and of the belief engendered by that resolution amongst people in Scotland that the new Parliament building would cost £195 million, that any revised cost limits, quality standards or completion dates under consideration by the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body or the Holyrood Progress Group must be laid for debate and approval before the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1844 Cost Limits of the Holyrood Project (lodged on 18 April 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Donald Gorrie*, Alex Neil*

S1M-1844 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cost Limits of the Holyrood Project—That the Parliament believes, mindful of the terms of the resolution on the Holyrood project agreed to on 5 April 2000 and of the belief engendered by that resolution amongst people in Scotland that the new Parliament building would cost £195 million, that any revised cost limits, quality standards or completion dates under consideration by the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body or the Holyrood Progress Group must be laid for debate and approval before the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil
